{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Personal Assistant",
  "description": "Mamacass Restaurants Limited, a Quick Service Restaurant, is&nbsp;recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Personal Assistant
Job Location:&nbsp;Ikoyi, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Administrative support:&nbsp;Prepare documents, presentations, and reports.Organize and maintain filing systems, databases, and records.
	Meeting support:&nbsp;Prepare meeting agendas, collate materials, take minutes, and follow up on action items.
	Research and errands:&nbsp;Conduct research on various topics and assist with personal errands as needed.
	Liaising:&nbsp;Communicate with clients, vendors, and other stakeholder
	Schedule and calendar management:&nbsp;Schedule appointments, meetings, and events, and manage the executive&#39;s calendar, ensuring no conflicts.
	Communication:&nbsp;Act as a first point of contact, screen calls, manage correspondence, and draft emails or letters on behalf of the executive.
	Travel coordination:&nbsp;Book and arrange flights, accommodations, and ground transportation for business or personal trips.


Requirements


	BSc in Buisness Administration or related field
	3 years of working Experienced as Executive Assistant
	Must reside on the island : Ikoyi axis


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume to:&nbsp;rshodunke@mamacassng.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2025-11-26",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Mamacass Restaurants Ltd"
    
  },

Personal Assistant Job at Mamacass Restaurants Limited




        
    

        
        Mamacass Restaurants Limited, a Quick Service Restaurant, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Personal Assistant
Job Location: Ikoyi, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Administrative support: Prepare documents, presentations, and reports.Organize and maintain filing systems, databases, and records.
	Meeting support: Prepare meeting agendas, collate materials, take minutes, and follow up on action items.
	Research and errands: Conduct research on various topics and assist with personal errands as needed.
	Liaising: Communicate with clients, vendors, and other stakeholder
	Schedule and calendar management: Schedule appointments, meetings, and events, and manage the executive's calendar, ensuring no conflicts.
	Communication: Act as a first point of contact, screen calls, manage correspondence, and draft emails or letters on behalf of the executive.
	Travel coordination: Book and arrange flights, accommodations, and ground transportation for business or personal trips.


Requirements


	BSc in Buisness Administration or related field
	3 years of working Experienced as Executive Assistant
	Must reside on the island : Ikoyi axis


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume to: rshodunke@mamacassng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Sales Executive (Forklift Sales)",
  "description": "African Steel Mills Nigeria Limited is a leading Manufacturer and Supplier of Steel Products, including Steel Bars.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales Executive (Forklift Sales)
Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos

Job Summary


	We are seeking a dynamic and results-driven Sales Executive with experience in forklift sales to join our team in Ikeja.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for driving sales of forklifts and related equipment, building client relationships, and achieving sales targets.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify and pursue new business opportunities for forklift sales in Ikeja and surrounding areas.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, understanding their needs and providing tailored solutions.
	Conduct product demonstrations and presentations to showcase forklift features and benefits.
	Prepare and deliver sales proposals, quotations, and contracts.
	Meet or exceed monthly and quarterly sales targets.
	Maintain accurate records of sales activities, client interactions, and pipeline using CRM tools.
	Stay updated on industry trends, competitor activities, and market demands.
	Collaborate with the service team to ensure customer satisfaction post-sale.


Requirements


	Minimum of a Diploma or Degree in Business, Marketing, or a related field.
	Valid driver&rsquo;s license and willingness to travel within Lagos as needed.
	Proven experience in forklift sales or similar equipment sales.
	Strong knowledge of forklifts, their applications, and technical specifications.
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to build and maintain client relationships.
	Self-motivated with a results-oriented mindset.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word) and CRM software.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;michael.eromosele@africanindustries.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2025-11-01",

  },

Sales Executive (Forklift Sales) Job at African Steel Mills Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        African Steel Mills Nigeria Limited is a leading Manufacturer and Supplier of Steel Products, including Steel Bars.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales Executive (Forklift Sales)
Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos

Job Summary


	We are seeking a dynamic and results-driven Sales Executive with experience in forklift sales to join our team in Ikeja.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for driving sales of forklifts and related equipment, building client relationships, and achieving sales targets.


Key Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Identify and pursue new business opportunities for forklift sales in Ikeja and surrounding areas.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, understanding their needs and providing tailored solutions.
	Conduct product demonstrations and presentations to showcase forklift features and benefits.
	Prepare and deliver sales proposals, quotations, and contracts.
	Meet or exceed monthly and quarterly sales targets.
	Maintain accurate records of sales activities, client interactions, and pipeline using CRM tools.
	Stay updated on industry trends, competitor activities, and market demands.
	Collaborate with the service team to ensure customer satisfaction post-sale.


Requirements


	Minimum of a Diploma or Degree in Business, Marketing, or a related field.
	Valid driver’s license and willingness to travel within Lagos as needed.
	Proven experience in forklift sales or similar equipment sales.
	Strong knowledge of forklifts, their applications, and technical specifications.
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to build and maintain client relationships.
	Self-motivated with a results-oriented mindset.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word) and CRM software.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: michael.eromosele@africanindustries.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Cashier",
  "description": "The Place - We are a fast growing, world class, and dynamic, multi-billion Nigerian conglomerates, established and managed by a team of professionals with decades of management consulting and accounting experience/ training from Arthur Andersen (now KPMG in Nigeria).&nbsp;We are a profitable player in the QSR sector of the Hospitality industry in Nigeria with great prospects and staff strength of over 1000 employees. Currently, our operations span across 17 locations in Lagos and Abuja, Nigeria, with rapid expansion plans to penetrate more locations in the short to medium term.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Cashier

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos Island,&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are currently looking for versatile, intelligent and energetic restaurant cashiers&nbsp;with passion for delivering outstanding service to join our professional and friendly team.
	This person will be responsible for providing passionate, charming and attentive service delivery to all customers according to our service standards in order to ensure guest satisfaction.


Job Summary


	As the Restaurant Cashier, you will work alongside team members in ensuring customers have a wonderful experience, deliver quality service and maintaining relationships with customers.


Key Responsibilities


	Ensures customers are attended to in a courteous and friendly manner and swift resolution is given&nbsp;to their issues/complaints
	Ensures sales entries are correctly entered and receipts are issued to customer
	Maintain excellent level of hygiene at all the time
	Must be knowledgeable about the company products
	Must possess suggestive selling skills.


Qualifications


	Minimum of SSCE
	Maximum of OND
	Experience in the hospitality industry could be an added advantage but not compulsory
	Must be between 18-25 years old
	Must be able to work in a team environment
	Must reside in or be able to work in Lekki, VI, Ikota, Ikate and Ikoyi.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-10-25",
  "validThrough": "2025-11-08",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "The Place - Smackers Limited"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",

      "addressCountry": "NG"

  },
  "identifier": {

    "name": "",
    "value": "189376"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",

Cashier Job at the Place - Smackers Limited




        
    

        
        The Place - We are a fast growing, world class, and dynamic, multi-billion Nigerian conglomerates, established and managed by a team of professionals with decades of management consulting and accounting experience/ training from Arthur Andersen (now KPMG in Nigeria). We are a profitable player in the QSR sector of the Hospitality industry in Nigeria with great prospects and staff strength of over 1000 employees. Currently, our operations span across 17 locations in Lagos and Abuja, Nigeria, with rapid expansion plans to penetrate more locations in the short to medium term.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Cashier
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Lagos Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are currently looking for versatile, intelligent and energetic restaurant cashiers with passion for delivering outstanding service to join our professional and friendly team.
	This person will be responsible for providing passionate, charming and attentive service delivery to all customers according to our service standards in order to ensure guest satisfaction.


Job Summary


	As the Restaurant Cashier, you will work alongside team members in ensuring customers have a wonderful experience, deliver quality service and maintaining relationships with customers.


Key Responsibilities


	Ensures customers are attended to in a courteous and friendly manner and swift resolution is given to their issues/complaints
	Ensures sales entries are correctly entered and receipts are issued to customer
	Maintain excellent level of hygiene at all the time
	Must be knowledgeable about the company products
	Must possess suggestive selling skills.


Qualifications


	Minimum of SSCE
	Maximum of OND
	Experience in the hospitality industry could be an added advantage but not compulsory
	Must be between 18-25 years old
	Must be able to work in a team environment
	Must reside in or be able to work in Lekki, VI, Ikota, Ikate and Ikoyi.
    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

{

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Facility Manager",
  "description": "Mamacass Restaurants Limited, a Quick Service Restaurant, is&nbsp;recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Facility Manager
Job Location:&nbsp;Oregun, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Delegating cleaning and maintenance tasks to team members.
	Monitoring the safety and cleanliness of interior and exterior areas, such as offices, conference rooms, parking lots and outdoor recreation spaces.
	Performing routine maintenance on facilities and making repairs as needed
	Scheduling routine inspections and emergency repairs with outside vendors.
	Ensuring proper security measures for the workplace, including collaborating with vendors and saving cost.
	Maintaining day-to-day routing / operations of facilities, such as delegating or completing maintenance orders on all company&#39;s equipment.
	Creating reports on maintenance, repairs, safety and other occurrences for supervisors and other relevant staff.
	Preparing facilities for changing weather conditions.
	Collaborating with building owners and upper management on budgeting for facilities needs.


Requirements


	Bachelor&#39;s Degree or HND in management, science, business or related field from an accredited institution
	4 - 5 years of experience in facilities/office services (operations, maintenance, security, housekeeping) locally, preferably in a Quick Service Restaurant
	Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office tools.
	Experience coordinating and establishing a new office and project Management.
	Prior work experience in a fast-paced, high-growth, complex, and high visibility organization in the hospitality and Quick service Restaurant.
	Experience to head a team and handle task by meeting up with deadline.
	Experience with information services, equipment recording and equipment maintenance.
	Flexible, well-organized and comfortable working well under pressure and with tight deadlines to produce high quality work in a timely manner.
	Must be ready to resume Immediately.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume to:&nbsp;rshodunke@mamacassng.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Facility Manager Job at Mamacass Restaurants Limited




        
    

        
        Mamacass Restaurants Limited, a Quick Service Restaurant, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Facility Manager
Job Location: Oregun, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Delegating cleaning and maintenance tasks to team members.
	Monitoring the safety and cleanliness of interior and exterior areas, such as offices, conference rooms, parking lots and outdoor recreation spaces.
	Performing routine maintenance on facilities and making repairs as needed
	Scheduling routine inspections and emergency repairs with outside vendors.
	Ensuring proper security measures for the workplace, including collaborating with vendors and saving cost.
	Maintaining day-to-day routing / operations of facilities, such as delegating or completing maintenance orders on all company's equipment.
	Creating reports on maintenance, repairs, safety and other occurrences for supervisors and other relevant staff.
	Preparing facilities for changing weather conditions.
	Collaborating with building owners and upper management on budgeting for facilities needs.


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree or HND in management, science, business or related field from an accredited institution
	4 - 5 years of experience in facilities/office services (operations, maintenance, security, housekeeping) locally, preferably in a Quick Service Restaurant
	Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office tools.
	Experience coordinating and establishing a new office and project Management.
	Prior work experience in a fast-paced, high-growth, complex, and high visibility organization in the hospitality and Quick service Restaurant.
	Experience to head a team and handle task by meeting up with deadline.
	Experience with information services, equipment recording and equipment maintenance.
	Flexible, well-organized and comfortable working well under pressure and with tight deadlines to produce high quality work in a timely manner.
	Must be ready to resume Immediately.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume to: rshodunke@mamacassng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

  "description": "Schlumberger Limited is the world&#39;s leading provider of technology for reservoir characterization, drilling, production, and processing to the oil and gas industry. Working in more than 85 countries and employing people who represent over 140 nationalities, Schlumberger supplies the industry&#39;s most comprehensive range of products and services, from exploration through production and integrated pore-to-pipeline solutions for hydrocarbon recovery that optimize reservoir performance.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Compensation and Benefits Analyst (Early Careers)

Job Location:&nbsp;Nigeria

Job Description


	Our business is based on recruiting talent and putting them in a position to succeed. Joining HR is your opportunity to see how a global, people-driven business does that.
	You&rsquo;ll be able to make a difference right away and our structured development program means you&rsquo;ll acquire the skills and experience you need to become an increasingly important part of our team &ndash; as you grow with us.
	You&rsquo;ll contribute to and lead innovative projects that are key to helping our teams do great work in a global environment.
	We have opportunities that include but are not limited to HR Operations Analyst, HR Payroll Analyst, HR Representative.&nbsp;


Requirements


	Bachelor&#39;s or Master&#39;s Degree in Human Resources, Behavioral Science, Psychology, or equivalent degree qualifications.
	Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.).

Compensation and Benefits Analyst (Early Careers) Job at Schlumberger Limited




        
    

        
        Schlumberger Limited is the world's leading provider of technology for reservoir characterization, drilling, production, and processing to the oil and gas industry. Working in more than 85 countries and employing people who represent over 140 nationalities, Schlumberger supplies the industry's most comprehensive range of products and services, from exploration through production and integrated pore-to-pipeline solutions for hydrocarbon recovery that optimize reservoir performance.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Compensation and Benefits Analyst (Early Careers)

Job Location: Nigeria

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Our business is based on recruiting talent and putting them in a position to succeed. Joining HR is your opportunity to see how a global, people-driven business does that.
	You’ll be able to make a difference right away and our structured development program means you’ll acquire the skills and experience you need to become an increasingly important part of our team – as you grow with us.
	You’ll contribute to and lead innovative projects that are key to helping our teams do great work in a global environment.
	We have opportunities that include but are not limited to HR Operations Analyst, HR Payroll Analyst, HR Representative. 


Requirements


	Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Human Resources, Behavioral Science, Psychology, or equivalent degree qualifications.
	Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.).
    

    

        Click here to Apply
